plain_text:
October 13, 1994
[NOT FOR PUBLICATION]
UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALS
FOR THE FIRST CIRCUIT


No. 94-1530

ALTON J. FULLER,

Plaintiff, Appellant,

v.

BOARD OF SELECTMEN FOR THE TOWN OF CANTON, ET AL.,

Defendants, Appellees.



APPEAL FROM THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT

FOR THE DISTRICT OF MASSACHUSETTS

[Hon. Mark L. Wolf, U.S. District Judge]
         



Before

Cyr, Circuit Judge,

Bownes, Senior Circuit Judge, and
 
Stahl, Circuit Judge.




Alton J. Fuller on brief pro se.

Scott  Harshbarger,  Attorney   General,  and   Thomas  O.   Bean,
                        
Assistant Attorney  General, On Memorandum For  Summary Affirmance for
State defendants/appellees.
Daniel R. Seigenberg, Gallivan, Santos & Beigbeder, on  Memorandum
         
For Summary Affirmance for appellees, Board of Selectmen, Conservation
Commission, Department of Public Works, and Town of Canton.





Per Curiam.   We have reviewed  the parties' briefs  and


the  record on appeal.  We affirm essentially for the reasons

stated in  the district  court's memorandum and  order, dated

March 14, 1994.

Affirmed.

37 F.3d 1484
NOTICE: First Circuit Local Rule 36.2(b)6 states unpublished opinions may be cited only in related cases.

Alton J. FULLER, Plaintiff, Appellant,
v.
BOARD OF SELECTMEN FOR THE TOWN OF CANTON, et al.,
Defendants, Appellees.

No. 94-1530.

United States Court of Appeals,
First Circuit.

Oct. 13, 1994.

Appeal from the United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts

Alton J. Fuller on brief pro se.

Scott Harshbarger, Attorney General, and Thomas O. Bean, Assistant Attorney General, On Memorandum For Summary Affirmance for State defendants/appellees.

Daniel R. Seigenberg, Gallivan, Santos & Beigbeder, on Memorandum For Summary Affirmance for appellees, Board of Selectmen, Conservation Commission, Department of Public Works, and Town of Canton.

D.Mass.

AFFIRMED.

Before Cyr, Circuit Judge, Bownes, Senior Circuit Judge, and Stahl, Circuit Judge.

PER CURIAM.

1

We have reviewed the parties' briefs and the record on appeal. We affirm essentially for the reasons stated in the district court's memorandum and order, dated March 14, 1994.

2

Affirmed.
